title: Prohibiting Certain Imports, Exports, and New Investment With Respect to Continued Russian Federation Aggression

enrichment.summary: This executive order bans certain imports from Russia into the United States, restricts exports of luxury goods and U.S. dollar banknotes to Russia, and prohibits new U.S. investments in the Russian economy. It aims to impose additional economic sanctions on Russia in response to its ongoing aggression. The order also prohibits transactions that try to evade these sanctions and authorizes the Treasury and Commerce Departments to enforce and regulate these restrictions.
potential_concerns: The sanctions may inadvertently harm U.S. businesses and consumers by limiting trade and economic opportunities related to Russian goods.
Implementation and enforcement challenges could arise given the complexity of tracking and preventing evasion of the investment and trade prohibitions.
The order could escalate tensions and provoke retaliatory measures from the Russian government, affecting broader diplomatic relations.
Determining what products and investments qualify for restrictions could lead to regulatory uncertainty and disputes.
The sanctions may disproportionately impact ordinary Russian citizens rather than the targeted government entities or elites.
